image.altText: A large military aircraft hovering above water near the beach, with spectators below.

items.synopsis: Three US marines remain in the Royal Darwin Hospital after a US Osprey aircraft crashed on a remote Northern Territory island, claiming the lives of three personnel.

title.children: 'Significant fire': The chilling moments after US Osprey crash heard on air traffic control audio

image.altText: Aerial view of rows of new houses in outer suburbia.

items.synopsis: With the RBA due to meet next week, a growing number of Australians are defaulting on their home loans as those borrowers at risk of mortgage stress peak at levels not seen since the global financial crisis.

title.children: 'A perfect storm': New figures reveal extent of mortgage stress ahead of interest rates decision

image.altText: A young man in a military uniform wearing medals stands with his Navy cap under his arm.

items.synopsis: A mother tells the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide her son was "in hospital dying" when he was medically discharged from the Navy against his will.

title.children: David Finney once appeared in an ad for the Navy. Two years after being medically discharged, he took his own life

image.altText: A composite image showing a jubilant Zelenskyy on election night and the same man somber in 2023.

items.synopsis: When Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy was elected president by a landslide he said he would only stand for a single term. During peacetime, the next election would be just months away.

title.children: Millions of Ukrainians have fled and martial law is in effect. Is a 2024 election possible?

image.altText: A man in a dark suit leans over a map

items.synopsis: Over the last week focus on the war has been diverted by the plane crash in Russia which is believed to have killed the leader of the Wagner mercenary group Yevgeny Prigozhin, but there are bigger questions, writes John Lyons.

title.children: There are five possible ways the Ukraine war can end

image.altText: Mother holding the wrist of a baby who is out of focus.

items.synopsis: A cultural review of Australia's prison system details harrowing accounts of women giving birth in custody, as a former inmate likens scenes to The Handmaid's Tale.

title.children: Woman handcuffed in labour, prison review hears as advocates say 'no excuse' for mothers' treatment

image.altText: A black-and-white night-vision photograph, taken from the air, shows a small group of dark figures outside a walled compound.

items.synopsis: As the race for the White House ramps up, threats by Republican candidates to launch military strikes on Mexico's drug cartels are being taken increasingly seriously, sparking concerns on both sides of the border.

title.children: Republicans want to use the military to attack drug cartels in Mexico. Is it just bluster, or could it really happen?

image.altText: Laura Kane (right) pictured holding a football alongside Andrew Dillon.

items.synopsis: Laura Kane describes her pride in becoming the game's most senior football official, an appointment that has been welcomed by the AFL community.

title.children: Laura Kane's appointment as new football boss by AFL seen as groundbreaking moment in Australian sport

image.altText: A humpback whale about to land on its back with a section of fishing rod in the foreground.

items.synopsis: Two fishers have a tale to tell after a humpback whale broke through the water's surface, drenching them and their small boat in its wake.

title.children: Whale leaves fishers gasping at 'most amazing' sight as it breaches metres from tinnie

image.altText: A smiling man wearing a suit embraces a woman wearing a football uniform

items.synopsis: Luis Rubiales made headlines when he give a football player Jenni Hermoso an unwanted kiss on the lips after Spain won the FIFA Women's World Cup. But he's clinging to his presidency of the Royal Spanish Football Federation.

title.children: There's been an uproar after Spain's football boss kissed a player. Here's what's been said

image.altText: A man in a navy blue suit.

items.synopsis: Lawyers for former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann object to Network Ten's bid to use a psychologist report into the behaviour of sexual assault victims in response to his defamation case.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyers object to Network Ten's bid to use psychologist report as part of defamation case

image.altText: Two people in high-vis orange shirts and navy shorts stand in front of a massive mining truck.

items.synopsis: A resources industry veteran says Australia's mining industry has an image problem and many agree with him.

title.children: With a 'dirty' image, WA's mining industry considers how to clean up its act

image.altText: Nestory Irankunda injury

items.synopsis: A soccer referee who is also a cardiac expert describes the moments in which he rushed to help Adelaide United young gun Nestory Irankunda, who hit his head and appeared to start choking during an alarming on-field incident.

title.children: Refereee recounts frantically rushing to aid of A-League star who appeared to be choking on his own tongue

image.altText: A man smiling wearing a white shirt and black apron.

items.synopsis: A court has found Mr de Pieri misused his position when he tried to tell a potential Mildura council CEO candidate what to say to an interview panel of which the renowned cook was a member.

title.children: Celebrity chef Stefano de Pieri blames 'brain fart' for 'gender stuff' text message to CEO candidate

image.altText: man wearing high-vis work shirt and base ball cap, looking away from the camera with glassy eyes

items.synopsis: Eighteen months on from last year's catastrophe, flood-affected northern NSW residents caught in limbo by the home buyback scheme call on the state government to fulfil its promises.

title.children: Craig is paying the mortgage on a flood-ravaged home he can't live in — and he doesn't qualify for a buyback

image.altText: A man in a blue and yellow polo shirt, superimposed next to an image of a truck crash site

items.synopsis: The 64-year-old driver of another truck died at the scene of the Bruce Highway collision in 2020. Phillip Sturrock has pleaded not guilty over the incident.

title.children: Truck driver hauling 14-tonne pump was texting son before fatal crash, court hears

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

items.synopsis: The Canberra man led police on a pursuit in May last year, during which he lost the front left tyre of his car. Despite driving on three operational wheels, he reached a speed of 160 kilometres per hour.

title.children: Man who drove at police officer at 120kph on three wheels said he had 'bugger all' meth in his system

image.altText: Picture of man with ear muffs on and glasses, smiling.

items.synopsis: The owner of a Wollongong real estate business has faced court where police allege he plied a teenager with cocaine and alcohol before sexually touching her.

title.children: Real estate agent allegedly recorded himself sexually assaulting teenager, court told

image.altText: Tokyo bedroom

items.synopsis: We challenged four reporters to find somewhere to live for 30 per cent of the average wage in their global cities. From "dorms for adults" to buildings that could be demolished at any moment, they saw it all.

title.children: What does 30pc of average household wage get you on the global rental market?

image.altText: A man in a black shirt sits beside water while a woman in a blue shirt puts her arms around his neck.

items.synopsis: With deteriorating health after four-and-a-half years in Chinese detention, a new diagnosis and lack of treatment could see Australian democracy activist Yang Hengjun die in prison.

title.children: 'If I die, people outside won't know the truth': Australian fears death in Chinese prison after diagnosis

image.altText: A fire consumes a large timber structure.

items.synopsis: The Sydney to Brisbane rail line has been cut by a fire in a historic coal loader that lit up the night sky over a northern NSW town. See the video.

title.children: Rail history up in flames as coal loader destroyed in spectacular inferno

image.altText: Four people are silhouetted against the backdrop of the moon, which looks massive thanks to a special camera lens

items.synopsis: This week's will be the second full moon we've seen this month. It's going to appear a bit bigger and brighter — but it won't look blue.

title.children: The month will end with a rare supermoon. Here's the best night to see it

image.altText: DSC01732 copy

items.synopsis: Her unconventional approach to surviving in the wild captured the public imagination. Now TV star Gina Chick shares with Australian Story how connecting with nature helped her through unimaginable loss.

title.children: Why Gina Chick says happily ever after is overrated

image.altText: A figure in high vis orange shirt and hat kneels to pick blueberries with a bucket of berries between their legs.

items.synopsis: There are concerns backpackers will stop coming to regional WA and leave farmers in the lurch should visa requirements be changed.

title.children: What will happen if Australia scraps the 88-day backpacker visa requirement?

image.altText: Eleanor Patterson and Nicola Olyslagers hold Australian flags while flanking Ukraine's Yaroslava Mahuchikh

items.synopsis: Eleanor Patterson and Nicola Olyslagers claim silver and bronze in an emotion-charged women's high jump in Budapest, lifting Australia to a best-ever medal haul of six at a world athletics championships.

title.children: Patterson, Olyslagers in the high jump medals as Australia enjoys best-ever world champs haul

image.altText: A view from above of a large flat piece of land with several rock walls and areas on top of a green mountain

items.synopsis: The tomb, which would have been buried around 1200 BC, was found with several artefacts which indicate it was for a priest.

title.children: 'Very peculiar' 3,000-year-old priestly tomb unearthed in northern Peru

image.altText: A woman wearing a black puffer jacket with long blonde hair and knee-high boots

items.synopsis: Danny Zayat is charged with murder over the death of his former partner Tatiana Dokhotaru, who placed a triple-0 call 20 hours before being found dead in her Liverpool unit.

title.children: Estranged husband charged over death of Tatiana Dokhotaru who made frantic triple-0 call

image.altText: An Australian female kayaker competing at the world championships in Germany.

items.synopsis: With three more podium finishes on the final day of competition, Australia tops the medal standings at the ICF Canoe Sprint and Paracanoe World Championships in Germany.

title.children: Aussie paddlers finish on top of medal tally at world champs

image.altText: Jim Caviezel stars as Tim Ballard in Sound of Freedom.

items.synopsis: Sound of Freedom has made more money in the US than Mission Impossible — Dead Reckoning, but its factual inaccuracies have some experts worried.

title.children: This controversial anti-sex trafficking film is storming the US box office and it has experts worried

image.altText: Zhang Jiayi poses for a photograph in the street with her parents.

items.synopsis: With her newly founded clothing company struggling amid China's economic downturn, 31-year-old Zhang Jiayi decided to join the trend of young Chinese adults becoming "full-time children".

title.children: Why young Chinese adults are choosing to become 'full-time children'
